getComputedDisplacement

  • getComputedDisplacement(local: boolean, atTriangles: boolean): number[]
    • Defined in src/lib/types.arche.ts:174
    brief

    Get the Computed displacement on a BemSurface after solving the model. Note that this attribute is provided at triangles, not at vertices.

    example

    // Get the displacement field at nodes in global coordinate system const displ = surface.getComputedDisplacement(false, false) for (let i=0; i<displ.length; i+=3) { // notice the increment console.log(displ[i], displ[i+1], displ[i+2]) }

    Parameters

    • local: boolean

      True if you want displacement vectors in local coordinate system (e.g., to display iso-contours on the surface), false for the global coordinate system (e.g., if you wan to deform the surface according to the displacement field)

    • atTriangles: boolean

      True if you want the returned displacement field to be at triangles, otherwise it will be defined (interpolate) at vertices.

    Returns number[]

    An array of packed displacement vector [x,y,z...x,y,z]

setBC

  • setBC(axis: number, type: string, value: any): void
    • Defined in src/lib/types.arche.ts:148
    brief

    Set the boundary type and value for each axis of the triangles making a surface discontinuity.

    For instance, in Okada convention, setting, for the x-axis, the boundary condition type to traction and its value > 0 is equivalent to applying a "pressure".

    example

    const rho = 2100 const g = 9.81 surface.setBC(0, "free" , 0) surface.setBC(1, "locked", 0) surface.setBC(2, "free" , (x,y,z) => 1e3 + rhogz)

    Parameters

    • axis: number

      The axis index (from 0 to 2 with 0 being the z-axis, 1 the y axis and 2 the x-axis)

    • type: string

      The type of boundary condition for the considered axis. For traction condition, value can be either "t", "0", "free", "traction", "neumann" or "unknown". All these values have the same meaning. For displacement condition, value can be either "b", "1", "displ", "displacement", "fixed", "dirichlet", "locked" or "imposed". All these values have the same meaning. When an axis is free, it means that the provided boundary value will a traction component (along the axis) since the displacement is unknown. Similarly, when the boundary condition is "locked", the provided value is an imposed displacement along the axis.

    • value: any

      The boundary value for the considered axis. It can be either a constant (number or string) or a callback with parameter (x,y,z), the center of the considered triangle, and returning a number. If the value is a callbak, then the signature is double cb(double x, double y, double z).

    Returns void

setDispl

    • Defined in src/lib/types.arche.ts:156
